result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(notice given to deft in court on 02-21-22)
Victim Identification Key.
RE:  Incent with child by stepparent, between October 3 and 4, 2021.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 01-28-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of incest with child by step parent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-21-223 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with J.M.S., DOB: 01-19-2005 and any premises she may occupy; defendant is to have no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 except those living in his home and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
